I loved this movie! It was all I could do not to break down into tears while watching it, but it is really very uplifting. A teen-aged girl gets the horse of her dreams and is trained by an ex-Jockey to participate in London's Grand National Steeplechase. In the course of her training, the girl meets a charming aristocrat who offers to fix the race for an exorbitant price. The girl decides to accept the terms in order to finance the horse and to pay for a great horse substitute who is a magnificent runner.

This is probably the only female Ninja movie ever made. It's great as a B film and the action sequences are a lot of fun to watch. Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. Centered on Miyazawa’s own life, the film depicts his adolescence in the country, which he spent intensively reading books, and his young adulthood in Chicago, which proved to be a formative experience.
